extends java.lang.Object
implements Future<T>

        public SimpleFuture()

    • Method Detail

      • result

        public T result()
        Returns the result of the operation. If the operation has not yet completed, or if it failed it will return null.
        Specified by:
        result in interface Future<T>

      • exception

        public java.lang.Exception exception()
        Returns the exception. An exception is always set if the operation failed. If the operation has not yet completed, or if it succeeded it will return null.
        Specified by:
        exception in interface Future<T>

      • complete

        public boolean complete()
        This will return true if the operation has completed, or failed.
        Specified by:
        complete in interface Future<T>

      • succeeded

        public boolean succeeded()
        Has the operation succeeded?
        Specified by:
        succeeded in interface Future<T>

      • failed

        public boolean failed()
        Did the operation fail?
        Specified by:
        failed in interface Future<T>

      • handler

        public Future<T> handler(CompletionHandler<T> completionHandler)
        Set a handler on the Future. If the operation has already completed it will be called immediately, otherwise it will be called when the operation completes or fails, passing in a reference to this.
        Specified by:
        handler in interface Future<T>

      • setResult

        public void setResult(T result)
        Call this method with the result of the action when it is complete.

      • setException

        public void setException(java.lang.Exception e)
        Call this method with an Exception if the action failed
